sentences.english: Ting Wen before the train, he jumped onto the platform.
sentences.chinese: 火車還沒停穩，他就跳上了月臺。

sentences.english: All southbound trains leave from platform one.
sentences.chinese: 所有南下的列車都從第一月臺開出。

sentences.english: Please mind the platform screen doors while alighting.
sentences.chinese: 落車乘客請留意月臺幕門。

sentences.english: The platform of new Tai-An Station.
sentences.chinese: 新泰安站的高架月臺和站構。

sentences.english: She followed him to the platform, standing back while he bought tickets.
sentences.chinese: 她跟着他到了月臺，站在後面，而他在買車票。

sentences.english: Next stop is Locwood, please mind the platform gap.
sentences.chinese: 下一站系樂湖，請小心月臺與車箱間之空隙。

sentences.english: They were refused the use of a telephone to call the police, so they bought platform tickets.
sentences.chinese: 這三名男子拒絕撥打電話報警，所以他們買了月臺票。

sentences.english: This photo shows the platforms and train depot of the station.
sentences.chinese: 圖中所見是竹東車站的月臺與車庫。

sentences.english: You will just have to chop up the psds they made.
sentences.chinese: 您只砍了他們在月臺幕門。

sentences.english: I looked to the railway platform, over whose fences there were several sellers waiting for customers.
sentences.chinese: 我看那邊月臺的柵欄外有幾個賣東西的等着顧客。

sentences.english: At what platform does the train come?
sentences.chinese: 火車將停在哪一個月臺？

sentences.english: We will provide the whole GUI diagrams and PSDs.
sentences.chinese: 我們將提供全圖形界面圖和月臺幕門。

sentences.english: You need to go to the opposite platform.
sentences.chinese: 你要到對面的月臺纔對。

sentences.english: It was cold on the railway platform so we hurried into the warm waiting room.
sentences.chinese: 月臺很冷，所以我們趕緊躲到溫暖的候車室。

sentences.english: I have the psds all made.
The train was standing at platform 2.
sentences.chinese: 那班火車停在第二月臺。

definition: Tsing Ma Bridge (to Hong Kong Airport)
head of a flight of stairs
attendant on an airplane, train, boat etc
Tuku town in Yunlin county 雲林縣|云林县[Yun2 lin2 xian4], Taiwan
area in the Shangcheng district of Hangzhou
open sluice gate/(toll) station/boarding gate (airport etc)/(fig.) gateway (access point)
Kai Tak Airport, international airport of Hong Kong from 1925 to 1998
